description: The CompTIA Project+ show is a series that discusses, shows and examines different project management skills needed to successfully manage projects.  The series is designed for the person needing to gain the core knowledge and skills to manage, lead, direct or even be part of small to medium scale projects.  It is also based on the PK0-003 exam objectives, covering each domain and objective for the CompTIA Project+ candidate.  The goal is therefore twofold:  to provide knowledge for the professional certification candidate as well as to provide practical knowledge and skills for the project participant and project management professional.
descriptionMD: The CompTIA Project+ show is a series that discusses, shows and examines different project management skills needed to successfully manage projects.  The series is designed for the person needing to gain the core knowledge and skills to manage, lead, direct or even be part of small to medium scale projects.  It is also based on the PK0-003 exam objectives, covering each domain and objective for the CompTIA Project+ candidate.  The goal is therefore twofold:  to provide knowledge for the professional certification candidate as well as to provide practical knowledge and skills for the project participant and project management professional. __[Click here](https://itpro.tv/comptia-partnership) to get an exam voucher discount.__
name: Project+
subtitle: Project Management

episodes.description: The CompTIA Project+ show is a series that discusses, shows and examines different project management skills needed to successfully manage projects.  The series is designed for the person needing to gain the core knowledge and skills to manage, lead, direct or even be part of small to medium scale projects.  It is also based on the PK0-003 exam objectives, covering each domain and objective for the CompTIA Project+ candidate.  The goal is therefore twofold:  to provide knowledge for the professional certification candidate as well as to provide practical knowledge and skills for the project participant and project management professional.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel start walking you through pre-project setup. They begin by taking you through the pre-project steps, starting with identifying the project which helps to describe the template of what the project will accomplish. The next step covered is validation, where the justification and feasibility is inspected as well as demand and possible stakeholders.
episodes.title: Explain Pre-Project Setup

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel continue explaining the pre-project planning steps, picking up here with project selection and decision models. They take the time to explain the common decision models like Benefits Measurements which include, Cost/Benefit, Scoring, Payback Period, and Economic, as well as Constrained Optimization and Expert Judgement.
episodes.title: Explain Pre-Project Setup Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel conclude their exposition of the pre-project setup steps, starting here with preparing a Project Charter which is the official documentation and guidelines of the project. Then they explain the Charter approval process; wrapping things up with where the Project Manager fits into the process with regards to their role and expected skills.
episodes.title: Explain Pre-Project Setup Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel take the time to help properly identify the characteristics of a project. They also go through the attributes of an operation, so that you are able to properly discern the difference betwixt the two.
episodes.title: What is a Project

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel walk you through the project validation process. They begin by showing the need to justify a project due to some demand or business need such as market demand, customer request, technology advance, or legal requirement. They also look at how benefits to the organization are grounds for a project's existence. Finally, they also cover topics like feasibility and strategic plan alignment.
episodes.title: Validate a Project

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explain the components of a project Charter. They take you through common elements found in a project Charter; elements such as the Problem Statement, constraints, risks, and objectives. Understanding how to draft a Charter will give your projects a well defined scope and boundaries.
episodes.title: Prepare a Charter

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel continue explaining how to prepare a project charter. Here they get into the development of the charter consisting of the previously discussed elements (inputs and tools/techniques). They will also describe other components of a charter(output) like key deliverables, milestones, cost estimates and stakeholders.
episodes.title: Prepare a Charter Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explain the elements that make up Process Groups, which includes Inputs, Tools, and Outputs. Then they explain how to outline the 5 process groups, specifically initiation/pre-project setup, planning, executing, monitoring, and closing.
episodes.title: Outline Process Groups

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explain the different types of organizational structures and how the role of a project manager fits into those structures. The organizational structures covered include Functional, Weak Matrix, (Balanced) Matrix, Strong Matrix, and Projectized. They also look at the impact each type of organizational structure has on Project Management.
episodes.title: Explain Organizational Structures

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel describe how you create a scope management plan while project planning. They begin by going through the first of three major scope components which is the Scope Management Plan. They break the scope management plan down into its component documentation. Then they look at the inputs and the scope change process make allowances for scope deviation.
episodes.title: Prepare a Scope Management Plan

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel describe how you create a scope management plan while project planning. Here they pick back up by looking at the 2nd of the three major scope components which is the scope statement. Then they finish by scope statement validation to stakeholders.
episodes.title: Prepare a Scope Management Plan Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the Work Breakdown Structure or WBS. They begin by explaining what a WBS is and its purpose as well as some of the benefits of using a WBS. Then they take you through the levels typically found in a WBS and wrap things up by identifying the planning processes that utilize a WBS as input. Also discussed is WBS dictionaries.
episodes.title: Explain Work Breakdown Structure

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie dive into the exciting world of managing project changes. They begin by explaining what is meant by a project change and how you can go about formally requesting and documenting said changes. They will show you the forms needed, explain the approval process, and turnaround times; then walk you through document routing and communication flow to distribute the changes to project team members and stakeholders.
episodes.title: Manage Project Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie take you through developing a project schedule. They begin by looking at the inputs that will help define the schedule as well as working with a Project Management Information System. Then they define the different identity types such as Mandatory Dependencies, Discretionary Dependencies, and External Dependencies.
episodes.title: Develop a Project Schedule

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie finish developing a project schedule, picking back up with task relationships. Then they show how to determine the critical path of a project schedule as well as how to establish schedule baselines.
episodes.title: Develop a Project Schedule Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain how to choose the appropriate methods for estimating duration before completion. In other words, figure out how long the project will last before it's done. They go over the common tools and methods used to that end, tools like Expert Judgement, Parametric Estimate, Three-point Estimate, PERT formulas and Gantt charts.
episodes.title: Pick a Project Tool

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie finish exploring methods of calculating duration estimates. They round out the show with methods like Critical Path Method (CPM), Crashing, and Fast Tracking.
episodes.title: Pick a Project Tool Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the concept and practice of logical diagramming your projects. They take you through various diagramming methods like Precedence Diagramming Method(PDM), Arrow Diagramming Method(ADM), Conditional Diagramming Method(CDM), and Critical Chain Method(CCM). They also look at using Graphical Evaluation and Review Technique, or GERT, to account for looping activities.
episodes.title: Setup Logical Diagramming

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain how to get the right information to the right people at the right time through developing a communications plan. They go through the key elements of a good communications plan starting with a Distribution List to identify those that need to be "in the loop". Then they go on to explain communications formats, the frequency of communication, as well as the common methods of information distribution.
episodes.title: Plan Project Communications

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie walk you through developing a plan for risk management. They begin by explaining the 3 major components of risk management plans, which include Identifying the Risks, Analyzing the Potential Impact, and Appropriate Responses to high risk areas with great impact. They break each one of these areas down in detail, giving you a solid foundational knowledge and tools to develop your risk management plan.
episodes.title: Plan for Risk Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the concepts and tools used to aid in planning out your resource management. They begin by identifying existing resource availability, which may be in human, equipment, or material form. They then use tools like the Responsibility Assignment Matrix(RAM) and RACI chart (Responsible, Accountable, Consult, Inform) to figure out resource assignment and management.
episodes.title: Plan Resource Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie identify and discuss the components of a quality management plan. Specifically, they explain the Quality Assurance(QA) processes, the Quality Control(QC) processes, and then show you how to measure your quality by using different metrics.
episodes.title: Plan Quality Mangement

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie identify and discuss the components of a cost management plan. They begin by explaining Control Limits and Cost Estimates. Then they explain how to create a project budget. Finally they take a look at the idea of a Cost Baseline to measure and track actual project spending.
episodes.title: Plan Cost Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the process of procurement when your project goals are outside your companies current capabilities. They take you through assessing areas that may require procurement of service through techniques like Requests For Information/Quote/Proposal(RFI/RFQ/RFP) as well as assessing and selecting a contractor or vendor. Finally, they discuss contract development.
episodes.title: Plan Project Procurement

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the purpose and common components of a transition plan. Transition management components covered include Ownership, Transition Dates, Training, Extended Support, and Warranties.
episodes.title: Plan Transition Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie describe the process of coordinating human resources to assemble a project team, build cohesiveness and perform individual appraisals. They cover the 5 phases of team development; Forming, Storming, Norming, Performing, and Adjourning. Then they explore team building through formal and informal activities.
episodes.title: Coordinate Human Resources

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue explaining how to coordinate human resources to assemble a project team and building team cohesiveness, starting with getting proper training for your team. Then they take on the topic of conflict detection and resolution techniques, specific techniques being Smoothing, Forcing, Compromise, Confronting, Avoiding, and Negotiating.
episodes.title: Coordinate Human Resources Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Daniel explain the importance of a project kickoff meeting and outline common activities that are performed during this meeting. They begin by explaining how a kickoff meeting is a perfect time to communicate the purpose of the project and set the tone and goals. Also, you can use the kickoff meeting to introduce team members, management, timelines, budgets, and team expectations. It also provides a platform for Q&A.
episodes.title: Have a Project Kickoff Meeting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the concept and purpose of organizational governance during a project's execution. They begin by describing what organizational governance is and how it can affect you as a team member. Then they look at common compliances implemented in organizational governance. This includes Standards compliance, Internal Process compliance, Decision Oversight, and Phase Gate Approval.
episodes.title: Work with Organizational Governance

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie begin exploring the scenarios in which components of a project plan can be affected and what actions should be taken when that occurs. Specific components covered here include: Risk Register, Communications Plan, Issues Log, Change Management Forms, and Quality Management Metrics.
episodes.title: Execute the Project Plan

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue exploring the scenarios in which components of a project plan can be affected and what actions should be taken when that occurs. Specific components covered here include: Project Schedule, WBS, Budget, Resource Requirements, and Scope Statements.
episodes.title: Execute the Project Plan Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain how to implement proper change management procedures; in other words manage change management. They begin by looking at identifying necessary changes and officially documenting it. Next they detail the importance of performing an impact analysis and then coordinating the appropriate course of action with stakeholders. Finally, they discuss how the project plan should be appropriately updated.
episodes.title: Manage Project Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie evaluate the impact of potential changes to triple constraints (time/cost/scope). They begin by re-visiting the project phases of execution and monitoring as well as the triple constraints. They also introduce you to the 3 project killers, inadequate planning, poor risk planning, and lack of change process. Finally they use scenarios to explain how deviations in any one area of the triple constraints will affect the others.
episodes.title: Evaluate Triple Contraint Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie show you how to use your risk management plan to determine an appropriate response to potential risk and opportunity events. They demonstrate using both qualitative and quantitative risk analysis to identify risks and opportunities, then evaluate risk response plans for both.
episodes.title: Use Risk Mangement

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Ronnie take a look at optimization through resource leveling. They explain the different tools of resource leveling such as fast tracking, crashing and delaying.
episodes.title: Use Resource Leveling

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Ronnie explore the concepts of quality assurance. They talk about monitoring quality by establishing a baseline and comparing the baseline to actual process. They explain performance analysis and variance identification as well as change request generation and implementation.
episodes.title: Use Quality Assurance

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Ronnie dive into change control and communication. They look at how to analyze data for quality control through comparitive analysis of baseline line reports. They demonstrate the different tools used like pareto charts, histograms, run-charts and Ishikawa or fishbone diagrams.
episodes.title: Use Data for Quality Control

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie show you how to calculate an Earned Value Measurement(EVM) and interpret the results. They begin by explaining the EVM and defining the components therein. This includes values like Planned Value(PV), Actual Cost(AC), and Earned Value(EV). Then they describe how to work with the efficiency indicators, Cost Variance and Schedule Variance. Finally, they work through Cost Performance Index, Schedule Performance Index, and To Completion Performance Index(TCPI).
episodes.title: Use Earned Value Measurement

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie run through a few more value measurement calculations. Here they cover Estimate At Completion(EAC), Estimate To Completion (ETC), Variance At Completion(VAC), and Budget At Completion(BAC).
episodes.title: Use Earned Value Measurement Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain how to effectively manage stakeholders through information distribution. They begin by looking at 4 methods to aid in this endeavor. These methods are: Managing Communications with stakeholders, Resolving Issues in a Timely Manner, Implementing Requested Changes, and Manage Stakeholders' Concerns Proactively. They finish up by explaining the most effective ways to run project meetings and send out periodic updates.
episodes.title: Manage Information Distribution

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie help you identify some constraints that my be negatively affecting communication between project team members and/or Stakeholders. Specific constrains addressed in this episode include: Time Zones, communication preferences, language barriers, hierarchical barriers, technological barriers, and cultural differences.
episodes.title: Identify Communication Contraints

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie describe the Project Closure procedure. They begin by explaining the importance and benefits of conducting a formal project close, discussing the Close Project process and the Close Procurements process. Then they detail the Post-project review process and finally walk you through preparing a Project Close Report.
episodes.title: Explain Project Closure

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue discussing project closure, this time looking at a few scenarios in which project closure might occur. They begin by revisiting the steps involved when closing a project and then introduce you to the 4 formal project closure types. This includes Addition, Starvation, Integration, and Extinction.
episodes.title: Identify Closure Scenarios

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie show you a few common Project Closure Documents. They examine and explain the details in Lessons Learned documents, Close Reports, and Post Mortem Analysis documents. They also discuss individual performance appraisals.
episodes.title: Identify Closure Documents
